intro: Mesembryanthemum stephanii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the morning and close in the afternoon. Mesembryanthemum stephanii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
